Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: 3D framework with vertically aligned nanopillar array

Other Information.Additional Info: The dense root of the MOF nanopillar array selectively blocks lithium polysulfides while allowing Li+ ion transport.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Kinetic sieving facilitated by lithiophilic sites

Other Information.Additional Info: The material exhibits high affinity towards Li ions due to Ni and O lithium-philic sites, promoting homogeneous Li deposition.

Sieving Mechanism: Selective blocking of lithium polysulfides through adsorption and molecular sieving, combined with facilitated transport of Li+ ions.

Experimental Validation.Method: Breakthrough experiment, visual permeation test, DFT simulation
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Li2S6 solution turned nearly colorless after 3 h with Ni-MOF-74; Energy barrier for Li+(DME)3 diffusion: 0.19 eV; Energy barrier for Li2S6(DME)4 diffusion: 0.37 eV.

Other Information.Additional Info: The Ni-MOF-74 nanopillar array is constructed on a CNT film substrate using a secondary growth method, creating a bifunctional material that serves as both an interlayer for suppressing polysulfide shuttling and as a self-supporting anode host for inhibiting Li dendrite growth.
